awd_abstract_narration:
Learning-augmented algorithms is a rapidly growing field that has proved to be an effective tool for designing efficient algorithms.  The Workshop on Learning-augmented Algorithms, to be held in December 2022 in Chennai, India, aims to set the agenda for the area by identifying important topics, questions, and directions for focused effort.  This meeting will prepare students and postdoctoral researchers to contribute to this important emerging area of research and will promote collaboration among senior researchers interested in this area.  The program will feature tutorials and talks by invited speakers.  Students of underrepresented minority groups are especially encouraged to participate.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

por.por_cntn:
The workshop on algorithms under uncertainty focused on learning-augmented algorithms was held in Chennai, India on December 16-17, 2022 with around 150 registrants from India and over 20 registrants from outside India. The workshop was co-organized by PI Panigrahi along with Anupam Gupta (CMU), Amit Kumar (IIT Dehi), and Ravishankar Krishnaswamy (Microsoft Research India). It featured a set of talks by distinguished researchers including Yossi Azar (Tel Aviv University), Ashish Chiplunkar (IIT Delhi), Prateek Jain (Google Research), Pravesh Kothari (CMU), Ravi Kumar (Google Research), Nicole Megow (U Bremen), Seffi Naor (Technion), Jelani Nelson (UC Berkeley), and Sahil Singla (Georgia Tech). The US-based students and postdocs whose travel was sponsored by the grant got the opportunity to participate in the workshop and interact with the experts in this reseach area. This also led to an exchange of ideas with other researchers working in related areas, potentially leading to new research directions and collaborations. The US-based participants also gave research talks presenting their own work to the workshop participants. The workshop added steam to the research momentum in algorithms under uncertainty, and in particular, to the field of learning-augmented algorithms which has emerged as an active subarea of algorithms research over the last 5 years.


Last Modified: 01/22/2024
Modified by: Debmalya Panigrahi
